definition: the back (human anatomy)/the back part of sth
the back of a body or object/to turn one's back/to hide something from/to learn by heart/to recite from memory/unlucky (slang)/hard of hearing
to be burdened/to carry on the back or shoulder
(lit.) chest sticking to back/(fig.) famished/(of several persons) packed chest to back

sentences.english: If possible, your back relaxing against the back rest.
sentences.chinese: 如果可以，后背在靠背上放松。

sentences.english: The hunter wnosked slowly in the forest! followed by his wolf-dog.
sentences.chinese: 猎人在森林里逐渐地走着，后背跟着一只狼狗。

sentences.english: Anna lunges at Jack and locks her wrists behind his back in her famous bear hug.
sentences.chinese: 安娜运用她著名的熊抱把用手腕锁住了杰克的后背。

sentences.english: The back is straight, very strongly developed without sag or roach, and relatively short.
sentences.chinese: 后背直，非常稳固，没有下陷或拱起。

sentences.english: I'll rub your back with this brush.
sentences.chinese: 我用这把刷子刷你的后背。

sentences.english: Ideally, your buttocks should be right at the back of your chair seat.
sentences.chinese: 正确的坐姿是，你的臀部应当紧挨着座椅的后背。

sentences.english: Press the skin of your back in toward your sternum to assist these actions.
sentences.chinese: 压你后背的皮肤向胸骨的方向辅助这些动作。

sentences.english: Walden clutched at the back of the sofa.
sentences.chinese: 沃尔登紧紧抓着沙发后背。

sentences.english: That piece of metal in her back hurts almost all the time.
sentences.chinese: 后背里的那条金属棒一直让她隐隐作痛。

sentences.english: Some wigs were so large, they covered the man shoulder or back.
sentences.chinese: 一些假发大得都盖住了一个人的肩膀或者后背。

sentences.english: Dress With Lining, Ribbon Fixed, Back with Elastic Band.
sentences.chinese: 此款连身裙有里衬，蝴蝶结是固定的，后背是拉橡筋。

sentences.english: It was great sitting in the hot tub chatting and soaping each other's backs.
sentences.chinese: 坐在热水浴缸内闲聊并彼此用肥皂洗涮后背是爽极的。

sentences.english: She also writhes around in the shower with her vertebrae popping out of her back.
sentences.chinese: 她也绕着淋浴下痛苦地扭动蹦出后背的脊椎骨。

sentences.english: I hadn't slept all night. My neck and back were like coiled 7 springs, and my eyes stung 8.
sentences.chinese: 我彻夜未眠，脖子和后背像绷紧的钢丝，眼睛刺痛。

sentences.english: It felt like a large chef's knife had been stuck in my back, " Goldfarb says.
sentences.chinese: 就像一把厨师的大刀扎进我的后背，”戈德法布说。

sentences.english: He let down the tailgate so the dog could jump out.
sentences.chinese: 他放下后背门，好让狗跳出来。

definition: back (of a human or other vertebrate, or of an object)
back (of a human or other vertebrate)
the back of the human body
